meanings.definition: To gather into a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: Children conglobe colorful playdough into various shapes.
meanings.sent2: She likes to conglobe her socks into pairs after doing laundry.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to conglobe the ingredients but ended up with a messy blob.
meanings.sent4: The artist's thoughts conglobe into a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The snowflakes conglobe into a beautiful snowman in the yard.

meanings.definition: To form into a ball or globe.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor can conglobe clay into intricate sculptures.
meanings.sent2: He tried to conglobe the paper into a perfect ball for recycling.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to conglobe the cards into a giant sphere.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams conglobe into a crystal ball of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The planets conglobe in the vast universe, forming a cosmic dance.
